reviews.title: We loved Peter Hotel in St. Wolfgang

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Hotel Peter for 7 nights in May and found it an excellent choice. We were given a room at the third floor (#306). The room was large in size and came with a balcony, with expansive lake/mountain views (we were told that all rooms have good views). In addition to the double bed, we also had a couch in the room, which was useful after a long and tiring day. The bathroom was spacious and equipped with a shower and a bath. The toilet is separate. Everything was very clean.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good, with a wide variety of choices, including cold meat, bread rolls, crossants, eggs, fruit, cheese, etc. The hotel has its own restaurant and the food was good.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

likes.liked: — Delightully caring staff in splendid accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff were friendly and the lady who looked after us (I believe she is the owner of the hotel) was very nice, exhuberantly greeting us every morning at breakfast. When we decided to leave one day early (to see more of Vienna) she was very generous about this too, not charging us for the extra night.
reviews.title: A splendid holiday.

likes.disliked: — Public lake bathing area is at the very far end of the little town. Worth finding.

reviews.text: St Wolfgang is a small village and the hotel is close to all amenities, including two supermarkets, ferry, bus stop etc.
reviews.title: Fantastic , friendly & clean
Excellent hotel, beautiful location
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Peter on half board for a fortnight in September 2006. We enjoyed splendid weather, and a hotel to match. Our spacious room was delightful – and thoughtfully fitted out with helpful extras. The balcony offered wonderful vistas across the lake to the mountains. Breakfast provided a rich selection of bread, rolls, cereal, fruit and cold meats – and even scrambled eggs if we wished. The evening meal was varied, attractive and well-cooked; our only reservation being that, with elderly appetites, we could not always do justice to the four courses. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, who went out of their was to assist when we had particular requests. Perhaps, though, our most striking commendation is in terms I cannot recall ever before using of a hotel. This is clearly a happy place, where the friendly staff and proprietors are obviously happy in their work, and do all that they can to ensure that guests are equally happy during their stay.
